TEXT.TITLE: Mount Chiginagak
TEXT.PARAGRAPH:
Mount Chiginagak
Mount Chiginagak Mount Chiginagak itself _ it it itself that that itself the mountain the mountain itself which which itself
is a stratovolcano in Alaska. In late 2004 or early 2005, a wide crater lake formed from meltwater within the summit crater. In July 2005, the southern crater rim was breached and the lake partially drained, producing a lahar with an estimated volume of 197000000 cuft which ran for over 17 mi downstream.
Chiginagak is an Eskimo name published in 1888 by the USBF.
